# constrainBoundsRect(_:)

**Instance Method**

Constrains the bounds of the clip view while the user is magnifying and scrolling.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor func constrainBoundsRect(_ proposedBounds: NSRect) -> NSRect
```

## Parameters

- **proposedBounds**: The bounds to use to ensure that the view will still lie within its document view.

## Return Value

A bounds rectangle.

## Discussion

Note that you can move an implementation of the deprecated [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSClipView/constrainScroll(_:)] to this method by adjusting the origin of `proposedBounds` (instead of using the `newOrigin` parameter in `-constrainScrollPoint:`). To preserve compatibility, if a subclass overrides `-constrainScrollPoint:`, the default behavior of [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSClipView/constrainBoundsRect(_:)] will be to use that `-constrainScrollPoint:` to adjust the origin of `proposedBounds`, and to not change the size.

## Scrolling

- **scroll(to:)**: Changes the origin of the clip view’s bounds rectangle to `newOrigin`.
- **autoscroll(with:)**: Scrolls the clip view proportionally to `theEvent`’s distance outside of it.
- **constrainScroll(_:)**: Returns a scroll point adjusted from the proposed new origin, if necessary, to guarantee the view will lie within its document view.
